thread.title: Surviving school with a food allergy
thread.title_full: Surviving school with a food allergy

author: ABC Radio National
title: Surviving school with a food allergy
text:
Image: Peanuts can cause a severe allergic reaction in some children. (Flickr/Dean Hochman/ CC BY 2.0 ) 
Imagine that sending your child to school means putting them at risk of a serious medical incident. 
Around five per cent of Australian children live with food allergies, and some of these are at risk of experiencing the life-threatening allergic reaction known as anaphylaxis. 
For these young people going back to school can mean spending large amounts of time in a less controlled environment, with an increased risk of a severe allergic reaction. 
So how can these children be kept safe at school? And what's it like going back to school for children and families of those with food allergies?
